poem:
Title: In Fearful Shadows

We twitch beneath the silver screen,
Coy dancers in a sordid dream.
Brit star, disturbing scenes we glean,
Of kindness wrapped in the obscene.

Cannibal feast, group passions seen,
Unravel that which ought to be serene.
Amid the violence, prying eyes convene,
Disquiet finds its own regime.

We attempt not to decipher or convene,
Yet, in silence, our complacency keen.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
